title: Raleigh passes Mantle, ties Griffey with 55, 56
content: Seattle's Cal Raleigh broke Mickey Mantle's record for homers by a switch-hitter when he hit his 55th of the season off Royals right-hander Michael Wacha.

content: Tom Brady did not violate any NFL rules by wearing a headset in the Raiders' coaching booth during Monday night's game, the NFL announced.

content: The Vikings placed running back Aaron Jones on injured reserve Tuesday because of a hamstring injury, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

content: Florida suspended assistant coach Jabbar Juluke for three games for his role in an altercation before last Saturday's game against LSU.

content: Katia Lindor minored in music at St. Mary's University in Texas and is a classically trained violinist.

content: Andre Snellings lays out what it takes to put yourself in the best position to win your fantasy basketball league.

title: ‚ÄòRemember how I was engraving bullets?‚Äô: Kirk killer‚Äôs chilling texts to partner ‚Äî big hint on motive
content: Tyler Robinson is accused of killing conservative activist Charlie Kirk. Robinson reportedly confessed to his partner via text. The messages reveal planning and motive. Robinson worried about a rifle used in the shooting. The rifle was a family heirloom. Robinson's DNA was found on the weapon. He asked his partner to delete messages. Robinson was arrested after a standoff.

title: Puja Khedkar‚Äôs family 'vanishes' after 'abduction' of trucker
content: Maharashtra police are searching for the family of Puja Khedkar after her father, Dilip Khedkar, and his driver allegedly abducted a truck helper following a road rage incident near Navi Mumbai. The victim was rescued from their Pune bungalow. Police accuse Manorama Khedkar, Puja's mother, of obstructing the investigation by helping the men escape and unleashing dogs on the police.

title: Trump lands in UK: Trade, Ukraine war and meeting with King Charles ‚Äì what‚Äôs on agenda
content: Donald Trump's state visit to the UK commenced amidst royal welcomes, trade agreements, and political debates. Hosted by King Charles III, Trump aims to strengthen transatlantic ties through discussions with Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer. The visit includes a "Tech Prosperity Deal" with significant US investments, but also faces protests and disagreements over foreign policy, particularly regarding the Ukraine conflict.

title: AI fashion trend: Google Gemini Nano Banana AI saree goes viral; 5 mistakes to avoid
content: The internet is abuzz with the Google Gemini Nano Banana AI saree trend, transforming selfies into glamorous 90s Bollywood portraits. Users are creating viral images featuring chiffon sarees, grainy textures, and golden-hour lighting using specific AI prompts. To achieve the best results, avoid low-quality photos, vague prompts, and neglecting background details.

title: More twists in handshake row! Match referee Pycroft unlikely for Pak vs UAE
content: Amidst controversy, ICC match referee Andy Pycroft may be replaced for the Pakistan-UAE match following PCB's complaint regarding his conduct during the India game, which led to a "no-handshake" issue. The PCB demanded Pycroft's removal from the Asia Cup, threatening to pull out of the tournament.

title: 'Vomiting, low blood pressure': Jair Bolsonaro hospitalised; son confirms 'emergency'
content: Jair Bolsonaro, Brazil's former president, was hospitalized while under house arrest due to severe hiccups, vomiting, and low blood pressure, according to his son Flavio. This health emergency follows Bolsonaro's recent sentencing to 27 years in prison for plotting a coup after his 2022 election defeat.

title: Prahlad Kakkar on Salman's obsession with Aishwarya, 'I'd bang my head'
content: Prahlad Kakkar revealed Salman Khan's obsessive behavior towards Aishwarya Rai during their relationship, witnessing scenes in their building. He described Salman's actions, including creating disturbances and banging his head on the wall. Kakkar noted the breakup's impact on Aishwarya's emotional well-being and career, highlighting her feeling of being unfairly judged by the industry.

title: Streamer Destiny under fire: Refuses to condemn Charlie Kirk‚Äôs killing; Elon Musk reacts
content: Political streamer Destiny faced backlash after refusing to condemn Charlie Kirk's assassination on Piers Morgan Uncensored, sparking heated debate online. Elon Musk criticized Destiny's stance, suggesting Amazon should stop paying him and advocating for imprisonment for inciting violence. Destiny, known for his polarizing political commentary, has drawn criticism for his outspoken style.

title: Trump-Modi phone call: US President extends birthday wishes; PM thanks 'friend'
content: PM Modi and President Trump aimed to improve India-US relations after recent tensions, with Trump calling to wish Modi a happy birthday and discuss bilateral cooperation, including trade agreement negotiations. Modi expressed gratitude and supported Trump's efforts to resolve the Russia-Ukraine conflict. This conversation marks a potential turning point after the US imposed tariffs on India for Russian oil purchases.

title: Asia Cup: Mohammad Yousuf cites 'barking like a dog' remark on Afridi
content: Following Suryakumar Yadav's no-handshake gesture, former Pakistani player Mohammad Yousuf used derogatory language, sparking outrage. Yousuf defended his comments by referencing past incidents. Amidst heightened tensions and a complaint from the PCB regarding the match referee, the India-Pakistan match proceeded, with India winning. Despite threats, Pakistan is unlikely to withdraw from the Asia Cup.

title: Lessons for founders: Zerodha CEO cites Nvidia chief; says success takes time
content: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath drew parallels between his firm's journey and Nvidia's, emphasizing the significance of timing and perseverance. Starting with a modest ‚Çπ10 lakh investment, Zerodha leveraged free infrastructure and focused on customer-centric policies like 'no spam, no tracking'. Kamath attributes Zerodha's success to being in the right place at the right time, coinciding with India's economic rise.

title: Asia Cup: How Pak, Bangladesh, Afg and Sri Lanka can reach the Super 4 ‚Äì Explained
content: The Asia Cup 2025 group stage intensifies as Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, and Afghanistan vie for Super 4 spots from Group B. Bangladesh's fate hinges on Afghanistan's clash with Sri Lanka, a virtual knockout. In Group A, India advances, while Pakistan and UAE face a decisive match for the remaining spot, promising high-stakes drama.

title: Aishwarya Rai‚Äôs breakup with Salman Khan: Prahlad Kakkar reveals emotional toll
content: Ad filmmaker Prahlad Kakkar recently revealed Aishwarya Rai's emotional state following her 2002 breakup with Salman Khan. Kakkar disclosed that Aishwarya felt betrayed by the film industry's perceived bias towards Salman. According to Kakkar, Aishwarya was more affected by the industry's abandonment than the breakup itself, as she felt the truth was on her side.

title: BlackBuck CEO‚Äôs rant: Rajesh Yabaji says 'breakup' with Bengaluru over potholes
content: BlackBuck, a Bengaluru-based IT company, is relocating from Bellandur due to severely potholed roads and agonizing commutes. CEO Rajesh Kumar Yabaji cited the deteriorating infrastructure and lack of improvement as reasons for the move.

title: Sofia Vergara‚Äôs past: From dating a Chiefs star to Tom Brady rumors
content: Sofia Vergara's past romance with NFL Hall of Famer Tony Gonzalez was unveiled by her 'Modern Family' co-star, Eric Stonestreet, during a podcast. This revelation surfaces amidst rumors linking Vergara to Tom Brady, adding another layer to her well-documented dating history. Stonestreet also highlighted his friendship with Travis Kelce, praising his grounded nature despite media attention.

title: Stephen A. reacts, opens First Take with tribute, after Molly's ESPN exit
content: Molly Qerim has announced her departure from ESPN's 'First Take' after a decade as host, with her final day expected later this year. Stephen A. Smith paid tribute to Qerim, praising her grace and kindness. Qerim expressed gratitude to fans and colleagues, calling her time on the show an honor. ESPN acknowledged her central role in the program's success.

title: Gabrielle Union opens up, late motherhood journey, breaking trauma cycle
content: Gabrielle Union reflects on becoming a mother in her 40s, emphasizing her commitment to healing from generational trauma before having Kaavia. She expresses gratitude for the positive impact motherhood has had on her life, while also acknowledging past struggles with miscarriages and the decision to use surrogacy. Union embraces Dwyane Wade's other children, highlighting the couple's happiness as a family.

title: Charlie Kirk tribute: NFL fans divided; Kaepernick protests revisited
content: Following Charlie Kirk's death, NFL teams' tributes have sparked controversy, drawing comparisons to Colin Kaepernick's 2016 protest. Fans are debating the appropriateness of honoring Kirk while Kaepernick faced criticism for kneeling against racial injustice. Some defend the tributes, while others highlight perceived hypocrisy, igniting discussions about politics, free speech, and the NFL's stance.

title: Colts respond: From pre-planned Forrest Lucas moment to no Charlie Kirk tribute
content: The Indianapolis Colts faced criticism for honoring Forrest Lucas instead of Charlie Kirk, sparking debate amid political tensions. While some NFL teams paid tribute to Kirk, the Colts prioritized Lucas, a key figure in their city. This decision ignited further controversy, highlighting the deepening political divide and raising questions about the role of sports in political discourse following Kirk's assassination.

title: Luka Doncic warns, Kobe‚Äôs unforgettable advice, starts first Lakers season
content: Luka Doncic's arrival to the Lakers marks a new era, guided by Kobe Bryant's early advice about facing skepticism as a European player. Paired with LeBron James, Doncic aims to lead Los Angeles to championship contention, carrying the weight of expectations and Bryant's enduring legacy. The team has been revamped with new additions to support their stars.

title: 'Positive, forward looking': India, US to intensify trade deal efforts; what happened in meeting
content: India and the US have resumed trade negotiations, marking the first in-person meeting since the US imposed 50% tariffs. Led by Brendan Lynch, the US delegation engaged in 'positive and forward looking' discussions with Indian officials, aiming for a mutually beneficial trade agreement.

title: Israel vs everyone: An Islamic Nato - Just a dream, or a future force?
content: An Israeli strike in Qatar has revived talks of a Muslim military alliance. Iran condemned the attack and proposed a pan-Islamic bloc. Arab states are questioning US security guarantees. Egypt is pushing for a joint Arab military command. Pakistan wants a task force to monitor Israel. The idea of an Islamic Nato faces challenges.

title: Cardi B sparkles, hints at marriage, romance with Stefon Diggs grows
content: Cardi B has expressed her openness to marriage in the future. She is currently dating NFL player Stefon Diggs. The rapper shared details of their romance, which began after meeting through friends. They made their public debut in May 2025. Cardi B is also focusing on her new album release. She plans to attend Diggs' games soon.

title: Asia cup - Pak cancel press conference ahead of must-win clash vs UAE
content: Pakistan's Asia Cup 2025 campaign faces turmoil as they cancelled a pre-match press conference before their crucial game against UAE, escalating tensions after threatening to withdraw from the tournament over a handshake controversy involving India.

title: ITR filing: Has due date been extended beyond Sep 16? What taxpayers should know
content: ITR filing FY 2024-25 due date: The Income Tax Department does not seem to have extended the ITR filing deadline for Assessment Year 2025-26, meaning returns filed after September 16 will be considered belated. While the initial deadline was extended to September 16 due to portal issues, no further extensions have been granted despite ongoing user complaints.

title: Middle East crisis: Israeli army hits military infrastructure at Yemen‚Äôs port
content: The Israeli army targeted Houthi military infrastructure at Yemen's Hodeidah port, citing its use for Iranian weapons transfers aimed at attacking Israel and its allies. This action responds to repeated Houthi assaults involving drones and missiles launched towards Israeli territory. Recent strikes also coincided with funerals for Yemeni journalists reportedly killed in earlier Israeli operations.

title: Jayden Reed goes viral, live from hospital bed, collarbone surgery update
content: Jayden Reed, Green Bay Packers wide receiver, had collarbone surgery. He then went live on Instagram. Reed's message, while under medication, excited fans. He declared the Packers would go to the Super Bowl. The video quickly spread online. Fans found it funny and hopeful. They created memes from his speech. Reed's words became a rallying cry for the team.

title: New record! Rashid creates history; India pacer dethroned for this feat
content: Rashid Khan etched his name in Asia Cup T20I history, surpassing Bhuvneshwar Kumar as the highest wicket-taker with 14 wickets. His achievement came during Afghanistan's match against Bangladesh, where he took 2 crucial wickets. Despite a strong start from Bangladesh, Afghanistan's bowlers, including Rashid, restricted them to 154/5, showcasing their prowess in the tournament.

title: 'Deeply concerned': India at UN condemns Israeli strikes in Qatar; urges dialogue
content: India has voiced strong concerns over Israel's recent attack in Doha, denouncing it as a violation of Qatar's sovereignty. At the UN, Arindam Bagchi emphasized peaceful resolution through dialogue, upholding the UN Charter. PM Modi also spoke with Qatar's Emir, condemning the attacks and reaffirming India's support for regional peace and stability, opposing terrorism.

title: 'Stop buying oil from Russia': Trump warns Europe; asks Zelenskyy to 'make a deal'
content: Donald Trump has urged the European Union to cease oil purchases from Russia amidst the Ukraine war, advocating for a peace deal between Zelenskyy and Putin. He criticized existing European sanctions as insufficient and reiterated his willingness to mediate. Trump also called for NATO allies to sanction China, accusing them of supporting Russia, while notably omitting India from his criticism.

title: "Had The Chance To Take Out Charlie Kirk": Tyler Robinson In Text To Partner
content: Tyler Robinson, the man suspected of killing conservative activist Charlie Kirk, allegedly confessed to committing the crime in a series of texts to his transgender partner after the shooting, according to court documents.

title: From Viral Sensation To Trump Target: How TikTok Became Caught In US-China Tensions
content: President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that the U.S. and China have a deal that would keep TikTok operating in the United States, in an agreement that marks a breakthrough in months-long talks between the world's two biggest economies.

title: "A Lot Of 'BS'": Hardeep Puri On Claims Of Biofuels Damaging Engines
content: Oil Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Tuesday dismissed claims of biofuels damaging automobile engines as rubbish and said petrol blended with 20 per cent ethanol is environmentally safe to use.

title: PM Modi Birthday Live Updates: On 75th Birthday, PM To Launch Projects In Madhya Pradesh
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is celebrating his 75th birthday today. He was born on September 17, 1950 in Vadnagar, a small town in North Gujarat's Mehsana district.

title: Maoists Offer "Temporary Suspension Of Armed Struggle", Call For Talks With Centre
content: The banned CPI Maoists, operating from shadows for decades, depleting the country of its life blood, are apparently suing for peace - cornered after sustained crackdown by security forces

title: MK Stalin Urges PM Modi To Address Fertiliser Shortage In Tamil Nadu
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin has urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to immediately ensure the supply of fertilisers to the State, warning that farmers could face a severe shortage during the crucial Kharif season.

title: "Retired Judges Have To Beg For Facilities": Top Court To Centre On Tribunals
content: The Supreme Court flagged the lack of proper facilities as the reason behind the retired judges feeling discouraged.

title: Trump-Epstein Images Projected At UK Castle Amid President's Visit, 4 Arrested
content: Protesters on Tuesday projected images of Donald Trump and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein onto a castle in England where the US president will stay during his UK state visit.

title: On 75th Birthday, PM Modi To Launch Key Projects In Madhya Pradesh
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to visit Madhya Pradeshtodayto inaugurate and launch several key initiatives spanning health, nutrition, tribal welfare, and industry. The visit coincides with PM's 75th birthday.

title: University Of California Sues Trump Administration Over Funding Freeze
content: Labor unions, faculty and students in the University of California education system sued President Donald Trump's administration on Tuesday over the freezing of federal funds and other actions that they say aim to stifle academic freedom.

title: PM To Launch 'Swasth Nari, Sashakt Parivar Abhiyaan' As He Turns 75 Today
content: The Central government will launch 'Swasth Nari, Sashakt Parivar Abhiyaan' along with the 'Poshan Maah' on September 17. The AIIMS Delhi will be organising Medical checkup camps at four centres.

title: EU Chief, Trump Discuss Increasing "Economic Pressure" On Russia
content: EU chief Ursula von der Leyen on Tuesday said she and US President Donald Trump discussed additional steps to tighten the screws on Russia over the Ukraine war.

title: Japan Says Won't Recognise Palestinian State For Now
content: Japan will not recognise a Palestinian state for the time being, and PM Shigeru Ishiba will skip a relevant meeting during the United Nations General Assembly this month, the Asahi newspaper reported on Wednesday, citing unnamed government sources.

title: Trump Extends TikTok Shutdown Deadline Again After Reaching Framework Deal
content: President Donald Trump formally extended the deadline to keep the social media app TikTok available in the United States until Dec. 16, giving time to complete the framework of the deal announced Monday.

title: Israel's Netanyahu Says Qatar Funds Hamas, Strike "Justified"
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Tuesday that a strike against Hamas officials in Qatar last week was "justified" by the Gulf state's ties to the group.

title: Charlie Kirk Killing Suspect Charged With Aggravated Murder, Faces Death Penalty
content: Tyler Robinson, the 22-year-old Utah man accused of assassinating activist Charlie Kirk, was charged on Tuesday with aggravated murder, a prosecutor announced, saying Robinson left behind his DNA on the trigger of the rifle that fired the fatal shot.

title: 'If Minor Voluntarily Leaves Guardianship, Case Of Kidnapping Doesn't Arise': Allahabad High Court
content: The Allahabad High Court has observed that if a minor voluntarily leaves lawful guardianship, then a case of kidnapping does not arise.

title: Probe Against Tesla After Parents Say Faulty Door Handles Trapped Their Kids
content: Car safety regulators opened an investigation into possible defects in Tesla doors that have reportedly left parents with children trapped in the back seat and forced to break windows to get them out.

title: Vaishno Devi pilgrimage resumes after 3-week halt
content: Pilgrims are advised to carry valid identification, follow designated pathways and cooperate with on-ground staff, the officials said, adding Radio Frequency Identity Card (RFID)-based tracking remains mandatory for transparency and traceability.

title: The hidden human cost of Artificial Intelligence
content: AI‚Äôs efficiency and accuracy are built on the invisible labour of low-paid workers in developing countries. From data labelling to content moderation, ‚Äòghost workers‚Äô face exploitation, insecurity, and mental health risks.

content: Launched on July 1, 2025, the campaign was conducted by the Department of Financial Services with an aim to include every last person in the country under financial inclusion schemes.

content: Jammu and Kashmir Congress said the Union territory has suffered a ‚Äúcolossal damage‚Äù due to heavy rains and floods

content: Party leaders flag off vans to screen ‚ÄòChalo Jeete Hain‚Äô at more than 50,000 places in the State to mark Prime Minister‚Äôs birthday; State unit will also conduct blood donation and various public service programmes

title:
Change in¬†PMK‚Äôs registered address is an attempt to hoodwink people, says
